contentList.content: The Harlequin is the embodiment of whimsy and enigma, a performer skilled in both deception and combat. They dance on the line between illusion and reality, using their beguiling presence and agile acrobatics to confound foes.
While under the guise of your Harlequin Alias, you may make Deception and Intimidation checks with advantage.
At 2nd level, you choose the branch of training that best defines your alias, providing you with features at 2nd, 6th, and 9th levels.
You move with a nimble grace that allows you to traverse the dance floor with ease. Your walking speed increases by 13ft if you do not have a shield.
Your next attack will deal bonus psychic damage.

After a successful weapon attack, go into a rhythmic stance. While in this stance, following attacks gain an additional bonus to damage. On a miss, you lose the rhythm and must start again. For every 2 Harlequin Levels above 1, This passive deals an additional 1d4 Psychic damage, up to 5d4 at Level 9.
Acrobats focus on extreme mobility to dance across the battlefield, and are capable of engaging multiple enemies from afar.
Jesters are masters of the fear tactics employed by harlequins, sowing chaos and dismay wherever they go.
Torch bearers embody the supernatural trappings of the harlequins, capitalising on their targets' fear of the unknown by employing unusual tactics.
You take no damage on successful Dexterity saving throws and half damage on failed throws.
You gain proficiency in the Acrobatics skill. You may double your proficiency bonus for all Acrobatics checks you make.
You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill. You may double your proficiency bonus for all Intimidation checks you make.
Starting at 2nd level, when you attack a creature that you are considered hidden from, that creature becomes Frightened of you until the start of your next turn.
Your fiendish persona is as effective as any armour. your AC is equal to 12 plus your Charisma Modifier if that would be higher than the AC granted by your armour.
You unsettle hostile creatures as you slip by them. Leaping near a hostile creature with your acrobatic prowess may cause them to become frightened until the end of their next turn.

You learn to instill fear through your combat prowess. When you enhance your damage to a creature with your Rhythmic Assault feature, you may cause it to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes Frightened of you.
You take your lightning-fast skills on the offensive, flinging multiple projectiles with unerring accuracy to enemies in front of you within a 40ft cone originating from you.
You are proficient with Torches, Lanterns, and Clubs. These Weapons are treated as Finesse Weapons when wielded by you.

You learn to wield fire in a dramatic fashion. You may exhale a potent alcoholic mixture to spray fire in a cone. Creatures within the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw to prevent taking fire damage.
Movement speed is halved and this creature may only take an Action or Bonus Action but not both on its turn.
Any frightened creature within 20ft of you has their movement speed halved and may only take an Action or Bonus Action but not both on its turn.
Whenever you deal fire damage to a creature, that creature is set aflame. it takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier at the start of its next turn. The flames are then doused.
Your enchanted insults are filled with hate. Target takes increased damage and receives Disadvantage on its next Attack Roll.

You may use your action to let out a hideous cacophony of hysterical laughter. A number of creatures that can hear you within 30ft of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall to Hideous Laughter for 1 minute.
You are immune to fire damage.
Critical hits or hits on burning creatures inflict fire vulnerability on failed Charisma save. Burning creatures let out an explosion of fire.
Attack rolls against you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. This is a bonus action that lasts until your next turn and resets on a short rest.
A reptilian costume with a strip of dark cloth covering any eye holes. You are famed for slaying your targets with a single light cut.
Always chattering and laughing, you frighten those with your maddened behaviour.
Your sensual hellish beauty draws many people in for a nasty demise.
Bravado and showboating inspire the meak to follow you. Little do they know its to their death.
A herald of death, your presence exudes a terrifying aura of hate.
A regal presence, you have woo'd many with your charms.
When you deal damage with a weapon attack to a creature that is Frightened, you may deal an additional [1].
Once per combat, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack while in Rhythmic Assault, you may choose to apply an additional [1]. Afterwards, your Rhythmic Assault goes on cooldown for six turns.
